frame.name: FR_Cognizer_affecting.to_do
frame.definition:
<def-root>Some <fen>Evidence</fen> persuades a <fen>Cognizer</fen> to perform (or not to perform) an action, or a <fen>Persuader</fen> expresses , through language or otherwise, his wish to get the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to act. As a result, the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms an intention do so, although it is not entailed that he/she acts. <ex><fex name="Evidence">The divorce</fex> <t>convinced</t> <fex name="Cognizer">him</fex> <fex name="Action">to get help</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Evidence">The price of a factory reconditioned tool</fex> <t>decided</t> <fex name="Action">it</fex> <fex name="Cognizer">for me</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex> This frame differs from Attempt_suasion in that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has actually changed their mind. <ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Results from the merge of Suasion and Eventive_cognizer_affecting, and the splitting into .to_do, .veracity and .legitimacy, based on whether the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is convinced to perform an action or that some content is true or legitimate.</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person that the <fen>Persuader</fen> seeks to influence to act.</def-root>

FE.name: Persuader
FE.definition: <def-root>The person who intends through the use of language or otherwise to get another person to act.</def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition: <def-root>The wish for action on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s part that the <fen>Persuader</fen> expresses.</def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>. <ex><fex name="Text">His speech</fex> <t>convinced</t> me to join the Peace Corps.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evidence
FE.definition:
<def-root>The eventuality or mental content whichs serves as Evidence for the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that he should perform the <fen>Action</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Evidence">The accident</fex> <t>convinced</t> him to drive slower.</ex></def-root>
